text: Typhoon Megi (called Juan in the Philippines) was a strong tropical cyclone in the western Pacific Ocean. It was one of the most intense tropical cyclones ever. The storm started on October 13, 2010. It became a typhoon the following day. The storm first touched land on Luzon on October 18. Thirty-one people died. Damage was over $255 million (2010 USD). The storm also affected Taiwan and southeastern China. Overall damage was $709 million. Almost 70 people were killed. Megi had winds sustained at 185 mph. Category:2010 in weather Category:2010 in China Category:2010 in the Philippines Category:Pacific typhoons
title: Typhoon Megi (2010)
